description: Worldwide Vintage Autos is pleased to present this 1978 Pontiac Transam.  400 CID V8! A/C. Must See!

Changes for 1978 were slight, with a switch from a honeycomb to a crosshatch pattern grille being the most obvious from the outside.[14] Beginning in 1978, the Pontiac group introduced a new special edition vehicle. The Firebird Formula LT Sport Edition which featured a revised 10% raised compression Chevy 305 V8 powertrain producing 155 hp (same as 1977 Chevy Monza Mirage) combined with a floor center console four-speed manual T-10 BW transmission coupled to a limited-slip differential final drive. The limited touring package (LT) also included a cabin roof, door, fender and hood graphics scheme, the Trans-Am sports handling package with HD gas shocks, modular alloy wheels and the SE Trans-Am rear deck spoiler with "Formula" word graphic detail. T-tops in 1978 transitioned from Hurst units to Fisher (GM) in mid year. SOURCE:  WIKIPEDIA

The term "restoration" in context to the vintage car world has taken on a definition of its own. For some people, a restoration is simply painting a car and replacing items as needed, while for others, restoration means an extensive disassembly and overhaul, with each piece getting rebuilt or replaced.

As a consumer, it's important to understand the basics of restoration levels for it can impact classic car values substantially. There are hundreds of ways to “restore” a vintage car or truck including but not limited to the following: i).
Body of vehicle is completely taken off the frame and restoration includes body, frame, floor pans (top and bottom), etc. these restorations tend to be extensive and costly. ii).

These restorations are when the body (or body and frame on a unibody vehicle) are disassembled and restored utilizing a rotisserie. Body of vehicle is completely taken off the frame and restoration includes body, frame, floor pans (top and bottom), etc. these restorations tend to be extensive and costly and iii).

These restoration are typically limited to cosmetic items including paint and body, interior, trim and emblems, etc. Within the three levels or restoration mentioned above, there can be varying quality from an “in the garage / amateur” restoration to a high dollar professional “concours” restoration. There is a universal 100 point grading system rating classic car conditions ranging from 100 being excellent to 20 being unrestorable.
In addition to the levels of restoration above, it's important to understand the type of restoration as well for it can also impact value substantially. Type of restorations include: i).

This type of restoration is geared towards restoring the car or truck to stock specs from the factory as if it were new. These types of restorations use original or oem (original equipment manufacturer) where possible. Factory original restorations tend to bring the highest dollars from collectors. ii).

These types of restorations are geared towards builder preference over factory stock. These can be refereed to as “customs” or “hot rods”. Typically these vehicles will have custom paint work, aftermarket wheels, suspension upgrades, power plant transplants, etc. A specific sector of custom restoration vehicles is “pro-touring” or “restomod / restomods” which are custom built with a more modern street performance and creature comforts than the original factory vehicle.
Please note that WWVA is not a restoration shop nor do we restore vehicles to any degree.
For questions on what type or level of restoration of any of our vehicles in inventory please call our vintage sales expert today at 1-877-422-2940.

We provide approximately 75 HD images, and an HD video, in every one of our listings.  Very few companies offer this much detail.  We spend significant time inspecting and disclosing detailed items on all of our vehicles; however, at the end of the day, we are not you... we highly suggest that you come and inspect the vehicle.

The information contained in this ad is solely for convenience.  The description is an opinion only and should not be considered a complete description of any or all faults; it may not be relied upon nor taken as fact or otherwise a representation or warranty of any sort.  Please note, we did NOT build or restore the vehicle. Vehicles are sold AS-IS, WHERE-IS with all faults known/unknown and with no implied warranty.  Unless shown in the photographs, we do NOT have documentation, receipts, or photographs of the vehicle listed.

We do not recommend driving a classic car home. Many classic cars are not driven often and tend to sit for long periods of time making them unsuitable for cross-country road trips. We strongly recommend shipping the vehicle.

We sell our vehicles mileage-exempt, meaning we do not know the actual, original miles. The information listed in the ad is based on the current odometer reading or from rebuild information provided by the builder, and cannot be used as fact.
Most of these vehicles do not have Carfax or Autocheck history reports; unless the vehicle is 1981 or newer, a Carfax or Autocheck history will not exist.

This vehicle is being sold by Worldwide Vintage Autos. All of our prices include a 30 temporary license plate, a clear Colorado title and VIN verification to ensure no surprises during the registration of your vehicle. We do not charge any additional dealer and handling fees!
Any vehicle listed in auction format may be sold, and removed from auction, at any time.
Have a classic vehicle to trade or sell?  Check our website for consignment information.
After selling thousands of classic vehicles, we understand the process and will ensure that you have a pleasurable experience.  Check out our 100% positive eBay rating.

Now for sale in our Houston showroom is this 1979 Pontiac Trans Am.  This TA is shown in a sleek silver paint that is in good condition free from any major dents & is a good drivers car quality there is one small dent in the passenger front & a few rust bubbles in the paint.  It is powered by a 6.6 L 403 CID V8 that is paired to a 3-speed automatic transmission. The black vinyl interior is in very good conditions and free from any major tears or cracking.  There is an aftermarket gauge pod in front of the shifter to show you all important engine information.  The dash carpet door panels & headliner are in good condition as well.  Ready for many miles on the road with your friends. It sits on its original 15-inch wheels that are in good condition and wrapped in Cooper Cobra tires that have plenty of life in them. This one does have T-tops so it would be plenty of fun in the summer cruising around with your friends.   This one isn"??t in perfect condition but it only needs a little TLC to get it where it would show very well. A perfect entry level car. Other features on the car include AC (working but not blowing very cold) AM/FM radio with CD player T-tops power brakes power steering power locks & power windows.  For more information on this 1979 Pontiac Trans Am call the Houston Showroom at 832-243-6220 or email
Evolve Motors and Chicago Car Club are pleased to present this 1979 Pontiac Firebird Trans Am!

This car is a perfect example of a “ten footer”.  While the paint does show well and shows little signs of age, with only very minor chipping (edges of the doors), the paint job was not done to a very high standard.  Paint has a nice shine to it, but the fact that the exhaust tips were sprayed over leaves us scratching our heads.  However, the good thing is that the car was originally gold over Camel Tan.  There is evidence under the hood of a previous paint job in red, but the gold that the car currently wears is the correct color.  Firebird hood decal is in great shape.  The body is in nice shape, with no dents or dings to note, other than a spot on the driver's side rear wheel well where the car appears to have been scuffed by what we assume to be a garage wall.  That spot was touched up, but it is still visible.  Chrome trim is very nice throughout.

The interior is in nice shape.  The dash has no cracks in it, though it does show some age, and the seats are free of any tears, burst seams, or fading.  Steering wheel has a leather cover on it, and is fairly worn underneath.  There is a scratch on the center console.  Radio, fan, and headlights are not functioning.  Power windows, wipers, turn signals, and gauges are functional.  A/C has not been converted to R134a and is not functional.  Windshield is clear and crack free, with no wiper streak.  Side windows have some light scratches on them.

The five-digit odometer reads 15,260, though largely irrelevant considering the fact that the engine is not the original unit.  The car was originally optioned with the 150hp W-code 301cid 4-BBL V8, but has since been swapped out for the more powerful (220hp, 320lbft) 6.6L 400cid 4-BBL Pontiac V8.  The underbody looks very nice, with no through rust of any sort.  Please take a good look through the photos, as the underbody is documented in detail.  Frame rails, rockers, and floors are all excellent.  The car will run nice and cool, but we would not consider this car a ready driver.  It will start just fine, but runs rough as it NEEDS A HEAD GASKET.  WE CAN DO THE SERVICE PRIOR TO SHIPPING, BUT PLEASE BE AWARE OF THIS. Tires should be replaced before being driven at highway speeds, given that there is some dry rot on a couple of them, and a brake service should be performed, as the pedal is a bit mushy.  Automatic transmission feels good, the car shifts on time and without any bucking.

Overall, this is a nice-looking Trans Am that would serve as an excellent starting point for a drive-and-tinker project.  While it could use some sorting, the car has a rock solid foundation and there is a lot to like about it.  Please feel free to reach out to Mike or Jake at 773-267-2684 or with any additional questions or requests.

Gateway Classic Cars of Orlando Florida  is proud to offer a super cool 1976 Pontiac Trans Am. There may not be a more recognizable muscle car from the 1970s. With a Phoenix on the hood and a thumping 400 CID V8 under the hood this is not a subtle vehicle. This particular 1976 Trans AM  has been lovingly restored and brought back to its former glory. This car has only 11735 original miles on it ( per the consignor) The body has been finished in a coat of beautiful its original Firethorn Red. It sits on the proper color matched rally  wheels that are synonymous with these cars. Inside is beautiful contrasting black vinyl interior with bucket seats and a center console housing the shifter. This car is very well optioned with AC power steering power brakes and AM FM Radio. Under the hood is a 400 CID V8 which runs and drive like brand new. Backing that of course is the Automatic transmission which runs to a Posi rear end . This TA is set up the way every muscle car fan would want. There are fewer and fewer examples of these cars to be found. This one has been restored right and is ready to be enjoyed. With only 11000 miles on the odometer the kinks have been worked out and the car has proven itself. Hop in and enjoy this one! You can see this 1976 Pontiac Trans Am in greater detail in our Orlando Florida  showroom or at www.GatewayClassicCars.com. Please contact 407-771-2000 or
with any questions. - See more at: http://www.gatewayclassiccars.com/orlando/1976/pontiac/trans-am-S793.html

OLD FORGE Motorcars is now offering this 1981 Pontiac Trans Am representing the final year of the second generation Firebird's.  This Trans Am comes loaded with factory options.  The anemic 301 V-8 has been replaced with more potent 455 V-8.  The white pearl paint is exceptional.  The blue cloth interior appears to be original.  Stopping is easily handled by the four wheel disc brakes.  Many new components including: new headliner, new carpet, sun visors, door panels all new weatherstripping, needs the AC hooked up, but the wiring is all new, rebuilt compressor new hoses etc.

Our 120 point inspection has revealed some mechanical issues that our shop is too busy with customer work to handle however we have tons of extra parts including Ram Air exhaust manifolds and brand new 11'' AC Delco clutch.  There is no rust.
Don't forget to check the video!  https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Y_KqbOWntww
As with all the cars we offer, we encourage independent inspection.

For sale in our Nashville Tennessee showroom is a big bad and built 1979 Pontiac Trans Am. Built with performance in mind this 79 T/A for sale is just begging to be taken to the streets or even the strip to show these new muscle cars what real power is! With just over 8000 miles on the build it broken in and ready to rock AND roll! This beastly 1979 Pontiac Trans Am is built with a 455 cubic inch big block Pontiac V8. This big block Poncho is the epitome of Pontiac muscle! Backed by a factory 4-speed manual transmission nothing is quite as fun as running through the gears in this big block 79 Trans Am for sale. With power steering and rare factory ordered 4-wheel power disc brakes this Pontiac moves side-to-side and stops just as well as it moves forward! The exterior is a rare shade of Sundance Yellow with the legendary Phoenix plastered on the hood. This 1979 Pontiac Trans-Am for sale is a true representation of late 70s muscle cars! The shaker hood rumbles at the tap of the throttle and begs you to let the beast within loose. The snowflake wheels are a staple of classic Pontiacs and can be found on this gorgeously restored T/A. Add this to the sporty and sharp lines of the Firebird and you have a car with looks that could kill! The interior is vintage style with black vinyl interior. The black sport buckets up front comfortably straddle the center console and 4-speed shifter while the back bench seat invites passengers to sit down strap in and hold on for the ride! This car is so vintage it even sports the factory prism style dash! Options on this 1979 Pontiac Firebird Trans Am for sale include: AM/FM radio cassettepower 4wheel disc brakes power steering tilt wheel power windows seat belts vinyl interior and aluminum/alloy wheels wrapped in radial tires. Now is your chance to grab one of the quickest rising valued cars in the market! This Sundance Yellow Trans-Am for sale stands out from the rest and is ready to be the street cruiser or street bruiser you want it to be. To see more HD pictures and video please visit GatewayClassicCars.com. For more information please call the Nashville showroom at 615-213-1800 or e-mail us at

T-Tops, four-wheel disc brakes, and a distinctive color combo... So even when all you are is searching for a great-looking V8 classic, a car like this 1979 Pontiac Trans Am shows you that you can get even more than you desire.

The paint is a true standout... and the same reason why this coupe caught your eye is also why others will gravitate towards it, too.  It's the kind of blue that was often seen on some of the earlier models, and it really looks great on the final update to the second-generation body.  We love how the professional respray of the Atlantis Blue gives this T/A the feeling of a deep ocean whenever the sunlight hits it.  It really helps highlight the angular elements that came on these '79s like the pointed Endura front end, wide body kit, fender side ducts, and the full-length rear spoiler.  Plus, the Trans Am script in a brighter shade of blue almost gives this a two-tone effect.  And speaking of two-tone, the best and brightest blue element of this T/A is the iconic hood bird.

For those who loved the exterior color, we've got even more blue for you inside.  Factory-correct and showing signs of being quite original, it's a true blue-on-blue coupe. And thanks to the T-tops you can easily share this full coordinating package with the world.  Looking at the condition of the vinyl bucket seats, door panels, dash, and center console, it's apparent that this has been a cherished T/A.  Full instrumentation was standard on Trans Ams, including the large tach and speedo.  The dials look great set in the iconic and aggressive machine-turned instrument panel. Ahead of that the driver gets the three-spoke sports steering wheel that should be quite familiar to Pontiac fans.  And while all this makes for a terrific sports car, there are also some very nice desirable comforts like power windows, and AM/FM/cassette stereo.

The 403 cubic-inch, four-barrel V8 is the original numbers-matching powerplant.  It lives in an exceptionally tidy engine bay that has the blue block radiating from within the deep back components.  But what everyone will really take notice of is the ultra-cool shaker-style air topper (although this still correctly inhales through the front.)  The big torque of the big V8 moves the sporty coupe easily, but there's more to this car's story.  The Trans Ams were celebrated for being one of the best handing vehicles of their time. And that's not only the suspension, but also upgraded pieces like the four-wheel disc brakes and grippy radial tires on the iconic snowflake wheel.  Add in the three-speed automatic transmission and power steering, and this is a great all around classic cruiser.
Great colors, great driving features, and the wind-in-your-hair T-top experience – this T/A is the total package.  And if you hurry, it can all be yours.  Call today!!!

T5! This 1980 Pontiac Trans Am is boasting an actual miles body with only 55296 and only 2114 miles since the build and restoration that was done in 2009.  As you look at the this beauty from the exterior is it a sleeper sporting that sexy deep gloss black and the large bird on the hood  she looks factory and the car next to you in the left lane will have no idea that you are about to destroy them. Options and Features in and on this 1980 Pontiac Firebird include: A/C Am radio Power brakes Power Steering Lots of Horse Power Antilock Brakes Tilt Wheel Seatbelts Vinyl Interior Radial Tires that are wrapping a Race ready Snowflake tribute wheel. For more information call the Nashville showroom at 615-213-1800 or email us at
The 1979 Trans Am is already an irresistible-looking classic with V8 power, but when you add in bold paint and an A/C interior, it makes this an all-around stunner at an obtainable price.

The second-generation Trans Am was a seriously intimidating package.  The wide ground effects in front of the wheel wells, integrated rear spoiler, and shaker-style hood, gives this a real presence on the streets.  When the dent-resistant Endura front end is as complete as this one, it's a dead giveaway someone took serious care of this coupe.  This new for 1979 look gave this one a more aggressive beak, that perfectly complements the hallmark hood bird graphic.  It only gets better as this whole car looks like it's breathing fire thanks to the blazing paintwork.  It's the kind of bright red that helps grab attention away from the black Smokey and the Bandit replicas.  In fact, this one reminds us a bit of another famous Burt Reynolds Pontiac.  Remember the red Trans Am hardtop from the movie Hooper? Yes, this one certainly looks the part from that speed demon stuntman flick.

Inside is a selection of the perfect features.  The black cloth buckets are high-backed and well bolstered for an exceptionally nice feeling.  Other comfort options include the power windows, power locks, cruise control, and a tilt column for the iconic three-spoke steering wheel.  The driver gets to face the cool machined aluminum dash, and everyone gets an upgrade with the AM/FM/CD stereo.  Speaking of everyone's comfort, there's nothing better than having the factory air conditioning ready to cool down this red-hot Trans Am.

The 403 cubic-inch V8 is the correct powerplant for this coupe, and it even features a date-correct block. It lives in an exceptionally tidy engine bay that has the blue block radiating from within the deep black components.  But what everyone will really take notice of is the ultra-cool shaker-style air topper (although this still correctly inhales through the front.)  But more than just look cool, the V8 inhales deeply through the correct Rochester four-barrel carburetor, and exhales with a sweet rumble out of the dual exhaust.  The big torque of the big V8 moves the sporty coupe easily, but there's more to this car's story.  The Trans Ams were celebrated for being one of the best handing vehicles of their time, and that's thanks to a full package that includes front disc brakes and BF Goodrich T/As on the iconic snowflake wheels.  Add in the three-speed automatic transmission and power steering, and this is a great all around classic cruiser.
A great V8 classic that looks stellar inside and out, and it has all the right features you want.  It's a total package classic that won't wait long at this price.  Call now!!

Gateway Classic Cars Houston Showroom is proud to offer this 1978 Pontiac Trans Am. Changes for 1978 were slight with a switch from a honeycomb to a crosshatch pattern grille being the most obvious from the outside. The engineers also revised the compression ratio in the 400ci through the installation of different cylinder heads with smaller combustion chambers. This increased power by 10% for a total of 220 during the 1978"?79 model years. The 400/403 options remained available until 1979 when the 400 CID engines were only available in the 4-speed transmission Trans Ams and Formulas. Shown in a recent midnight purple paint job that shows very well. This original 400 CID V8 WC code TA has a new intake manifold newly rebuilt carburetor. The 6.6L motor is mated to a turbo hydramatic 350 3-speed automatic transmission that has a B&M transpack & 2500 rpm stall converter so she is ready to ride and hit the streets.  The 400 CID V8 was rebuilt & bored over .030 over & had several goodies added to it at that time.  Including parts such as; forged pistons a Crane cam performance intake manifold a 750cfm Holley carburetor Flowtech long tube headers & Flowmaster super 40 mufflers.  The car has new rear tires with less than 50 miles on them as well as other maintenance items like a new power steering pump hoses & gearbox new brake calipers wheel cylinders alternator & valve covers. Options include: AM/FM radio cd player power brakes power steering tilt wheel seat belts. For more information on this 1978 Pontiac Trans Am call the Houston Showroom at 832-243-6220 or email

1979 PONTIAC TRANS AM 10TH ANNIVERSARY EDITION for sale. Motorcar Classics is proud to present this rare and meticulously restored 1979 Pontiac Trans Am 10th Anniversary Edition featured in the correct & beautiful color combination of the upper body in metallic Gray and lower body in Platinum Silver with a stunning Silver Pearl Leather Bucket Seat Interior. This frame-Off, nut & bolt restored Firebird is truly better than new and was done to the highest standards we have ever seen. Everything component has been powder-coated or painted using the correct colors and textures. The car shows only 33,812 original miles on the odometer. The original L80 6.6L 403 CID V8 4-bbl engine is mated to a 350 Turbo Hydramatic 3-Speed automatic transmission. This Trans Am drives and handles as new shifting tight and sharp through all RPM ranges. The car has the original 3.08:1 rear differential ratio which provides a good balance between performance and relaxed highway cruising. Luxury options include factory A/C, T-Tops, tilt wheel, power windows, remote trunk release, power steering, power brakes, power door locks and factory AM/FM/8-Track stereo. This trans Am has the coveted 15 x 8 Silver Polished Turbo-Flow Wheels (N90) and correct BF Goodrich Radial T/A tires. This is a two-owner car with all 's matching. Documentation includes complete PHS Report and original owner's manual. It was built in the 1st week of May 1979 (05A) in Norwood, Ohio, can carries VIN: 2X87K9N172606. This Trans Am was delivered by Forbes GMC Truck Center of Waterloo, Ontario, Canada to her first owner who resided in Kitchener, Ontario, Canada on June 9, 1979 for a very high price of $10,710.40 + Tax. You will not find a nicer 1979 Anniversary Trans Am anywhere. This car truly presents and drives better than new in all respects. This is a must see Trans Am for the Pontiac enthusiast that you can drive or show with pride.

The popularity of ''Smokey and the Bandit'' has made black-on-black T/As a classic that's always in demand.  But not everyone gets to find a 1979 Pontiac Trans Am that was born with this desirable color combo and is exceptionally well preserved today, right down to its original V8.

This one nails the Bandit look in every way that matters. Better still, it's a factory black car, so there was no color change needed to make it look right. You can tell there was plenty of time and money invested in a professional respray so that the modern clearcoat helps it earn its Starlight Black name.  And of course, the gold detail package really makes this coupe standout.  Everything you want is in place, so the hood bird is so bold that it's to be feared, and all the lettering on every side is crisp and clear against the midnight paintjob.  And matching this gold accent package are the iconic snowflake 15-inch alloys.  So yes, all your favorite parts of this icon are already in place.

''Black is beautiful,'' is the first thing Burt Reynolds said when he saw his Trans Am in the Bandit sequel, and this interior follows that line perfectly.  The high back vinyl bucket seats look factory fresh, and they provide the kind of all day comfort that would keep you happy bootlegging beer all across the South.  The carpets, door panels, center console, and every other key dark piece of this car have not lost its luster.  But this Trans Am doesn't just feel like midnight inside.  Just like the exterior trim, there are plenty of bright spots.  The driver gets to sit behind factory the sports steering wheel with a golden three-spoke design.  And beyond that is the machined aluminum dash that came on these upper class Trans Ams.  You'll notice this has all the right gauges, right down to the clock/tach combo.  There are plenty of comfortable features so you have power windows, power locks, and air conditioning.  Plus, we bet everyone will love it if you can find a Jerry Reed 8-track, because the original stereo is still cranking out the tunes.

The 403 cubic-inch V8 is original to the car, and it has an authentic appearance right down to the factory shaker hood that sits on top of the four-barrel carburetor. The block is still covered in factory-correct Pontiac blue paint, and it looks like this powerplant has been treated to good regular maintenance. The Trans Am has a reputation for not only being quick, but also as one of the best all-around handling sports cars of its day. That's due to the right features like front disc brakes, as well as front & rear stabilizer bars.  Plus, this one has long-haul comfort, too, thanks to a three-speed automatic transmission, power steering, power brakes, and modern Firestone Firehawk tires.

This one has a feeling of total quality.  You see it in the detail like the weatherstripping, and feel it in the way this one drives with confidence.  That makes a car with great originality, proper maintenance, and an outstanding presentation.  Your total package T/A is waiting... but it won't linger for long.  Call today!!!
Worldwide Vintage Autos is pleased to present this 1978 Pontiac Transam.  Excellent Condition.

Changes for 1978 were slight, with a switch from a honeycomb to a crosshatch pattern grille being the most obvious from the outside.[14] Beginning in 1978, the Pontiac group introduced a new special edition vehicle. The Firebird Formula LT Sport Edition which featured a revised 10% raised compression Chevy 305 V8 powertrain producing 155 hp (same as 1977 Chevy Monza Mirage) combined with a floor center console four-speed manual T-10 BW transmission coupled to a limited-slip differential final drive. The limited touring package (LT) also included a cabin roof, door, fender and hood graphics scheme, the Trans-Am sports handling package with HD gas shocks, modular alloy wheels and the SE Trans-Am rear deck spoiler with "Formula" word graphic detail. T-tops in 1978 transitioned from Hurst units to Fisher (GM) in mid year. SOURCE:  WIKIPEDIA

The term "restoration" in context to the vintage car world has taken on a definition of its own. For some people, a restoration is simply painting a car and replacing items as needed, while for others, restoration means an extensive disassembly and overhaul, with each piece getting rebuilt or replaced.

As a consumer, it's important to understand the basics of restoration levels for it can impact classic car values substantially. There are hundreds of ways to “restore” a vintage car or truck including but not limited to the following: i).
Body of vehicle is completely taken off the frame and restoration includes body, frame, floor pans (top and bottom), etc. these restorations tend to be extensive and costly. ii).

These restorations are when the body (or body and frame on a unibody vehicle) are disassembled and restored utilizing a rotisserie. Body of vehicle is completely taken off the frame and restoration includes body, frame, floor pans (top and bottom), etc. these restorations tend to be extensive and costly and iii).

These restoration are typically limited to cosmetic items including paint and body, interior, trim and emblems, etc. Within the three levels or restoration mentioned above, there can be varying quality from an “in the garage / amateur” restoration to a high dollar professional “concours” restoration. There is a universal 100 point grading system rating classic car conditions ranging from 100 being excellent to 20 being unrestorable.
In addition to the levels of restoration above, it's important to understand the type of restoration as well for it can also impact value substantially. Type of restorations include: i).

This type of restoration is geared towards restoring the car or truck to stock specs from the factory as if it were new. These types of restorations use original or oem (original equipment manufacturer) where possible. Factory original restorations tend to bring the highest dollars from collectors. ii).

These types of restorations are geared towards builder preference over factory stock. These can be refereed to as “customs” or “hot rods”. Typically these vehicles will have custom paint work, aftermarket wheels, suspension upgrades, power plant transplants, etc. A specific sector of custom restoration vehicles is “pro-touring” or “restomod / restomods” which are custom built with a more modern street performance and creature comforts than the original factory vehicle.
Please note that WWVA is not a restoration shop nor do we restore vehicles to any degree.
For questions on what type or level of restoration of any of our vehicles in inventory please call our vintage sales expert today at 1-877-422-2940.

We do not recommend driving a classic car home. Many classic cars are not driven often and tend to sit for long periods of time making them unsuitable for cross-country road trips. We strongly recommend shipping the vehicle.

We sell our vehicles mileage-exempt, meaning we do not know the actual, original miles. The information listed in the ad is based on the current odometer reading or from rebuild information provided by the builder, and cannot be used as fact.
Most of these vehicles do not have Carfax or Autocheck history reports; unless the vehicle is 1981 or newer, a Carfax or Autocheck history will not exist.
